intro: Erysimum bicorne, commonly known as the two-horned wallflower, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and basal leaves that are lobed or toothed. Its flowers are bright yellow or orange, with four petals that form a distinctive "two-horned" shape, giving it its common name. Erysimum bicorne is often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas, thriving in full sun.
